result.execSummary:
The defendant Michael S Seibert was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Methamphetamine, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(g).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Cash bail applied to fine.  Paid in full.
Straight time.   Sentence credit for 13 days was granted.

with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Defendant Michael S Seibert in court with attorney Matthew E. Weil.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern, Melissa Zilavy, appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant enters a guilty plea to Count 10.  Court finds defendant guilty.  Count 11 dismissed and read in.  Case 14CM781 dismissed and read in to this matter.

Court orders the following:
Count 10:
- 20 days jail (straight time) commencing forthwith.  Credit for 13 days.
- Fine totaling: $5,000.00; cash bail to be applied.

Defendant was remanded to the custody of the Sheriff to commence the sentence.
Filed by the State.
Jury trial - 12 person on October 28, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Jury status hearing on October 23, 2014 at 09:00 am.
